sub_topic: Finding the chromatic polynomial of a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following graph:

```
    A---B---C
    | \ | / |
    |  \ | /  |
    |   \|/   |
    D----E----F
```

What is the chromatic polynomial of the given graph?
message_2:
To find the chromatic polynomial of the given graph, we can use the deletion-contraction algorithm. We will use the edge connecting vertices B and E for this process.

1. Delete the edge BE: The graph becomes:

```
    A---B   C
    | \ |   |
    |  \ |   |
    |   \|   |
    D----E---F
```

The chromatic polynomial of this graph is P(G-e)(k) = k(k-1)^4 - k(k-1)^3.

2. Contract the edge BE: The graph becomes:

```
    A---B=C
    | \ | /
    |  \|/
    D----E
```

The chromatic polynomial of this graph is P(G/e)(k) = k(k-1)^3 - k(k-1)^2.

Now, we can find the chromatic polynomial of the original graph using the formula P(G)(k) = P(G-e)(k) - P(G/e)(k):

P(G)(k) = [k(k-1)^4 - k(k-1)^3] - [k(k-1)^3 - k(k-1)^2]
P(G)(k) = k(k-1)^4 - 2k(k-1)^3 + k(k-1)^2

So, the chromatic polynomial of the given graph is P(G)(k) = k(k-1)^2(k^2 - 3k + 2).
